nodes.text: So, worried about the test?
Yes, a little. I have spent a lot of time disarming the practice traps, but I didn't have the Master watching over me.
I don't want to make a fool of myself in front of him.
I don't know anyone in this class who tries harder or works longer to excel in this class than you do. Just focus on the disarming the trap and forget about the Master.
You'll come through like you always do - at the top of the class.
I hope you're right.
You don't need to let the Master pick on your lock skill. Even if you totally bomb on the trap - With your combination of smarts and roguish arts, it's a safe bet you'll be best on the test.
Thanks.
What's the matter, Thomas -  Afraid the Master will think you're too much of a Paladin to be a Rogue? Or is it the other way around?
You got this. Now you just have to prove it.
What's the matter, Thomas? In the close quarters of the lockroom, you're afraid the Master will see how fake your mustache and beard are? Worried he'll learn that you are a fraud?
Master of disguise, you are not. Good thing disguise wasn't part of Rogue Curriculum. After all these months, the least you could have done was grow a real beard and mustache.
Seriously though - you'll have no trouble on this test.

nodes.message: TODO: Should Shawn say something if the Drat Queen is undefeated?

nodes.text: You hang out at the library a lot - you must know some of its secrets... like a secret passageway behind a painting?
Why are you asking about this?
The reason that the Drats have invaded the castle is because there is a Queen Drat that controls them. I'm trying to stop her.
But the only way to get to her is through the dungeon - And the way to the dungeon is through the passage from the library.
Let's just say I'm looking into something for a friend... and it involves the secret passageway.
I'm going to stop the Drat invasion at its source - the Drat Queen. I've been told that the passageway is the way to get to her.
There is a secret passageway in the library, but it leads to the most dangerous part of the castle. You really shouldn't go down there. There's got to be another way.
Not from what I hear... this is the only way to stop the Drat problem.
So what do you know about a creepy guy who's next to the library?
<sigh> You really shouldn't disturb him. Whatever you do - don't get him angry. He's not dangerous unless he thinks you are an enemy. However, he's possibly the most deadly thing in this castle.
Who is he?
He's not so much a 'he' as a 'what.' And what that is, I don't know. I've been trying to find out in the castle histories. All I do know is that he will ignore you once he knows you are harmless.
Be careful, Shawn. There is real danger in this castle.
You mean more dangerous than Master von Urwald watching you disarm a trap?
Seriously, yes. Watch your step if you choose to explore the old ways.
I hope your day is going well.
